sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The history of Astrea the first part. In twelue bookes: newly translated out of French. Astrée. English Urfé, Honoré d', 1567-1625. Pyper, John.
[6], 373 [i.e. 371], [2], 64 p.
Printed by N. Okes [and T. Creede] for Iohn Pyper, London : 1620.
By Honoré d'Urfé. Printer's name from STC. Title within ornamental woodcut frame. Pages 372-73 misnumbered 362-63; 369-70 missing in number only. "To the reader" signed: Iohn Pyper. A translation, from the original French, of d'Urfé's Astrée. Pagination begins anew with Book 11. "No more published in this edition."--British Museum Catalogue. Some print faded and show-through. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======

[6], 373 [i.e. 371], [2], 64 p.
Printed by N. Okes [and T. Creede] for Iohn Pyper, London : 1620.
By Honoré d'Urfé. Printer's name from STC. Title within ornamental woodcut frame. Pages 372-73 misnumbered 362-63; 369-70 missing in number only. "To the reader" signed: Iohn Pyper. A translation, from the original French, of d'Urfé's Astrée. Pagination begins anew with Book 11. "No more published in this edition."--British Museum Catalogue. Some print faded and show-through. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
Iohn Pyper

T. Creede]
